item.title: Consensus Prototypes
item.description: Consensus Prototypes is a collection of Rust implementations of the Consensus Candidates Required Roles Lead Developer (filled)

item.title: Consensus Theory Work
item.description: This track of work is dedicated to creating theoretical models of distributed consensus in order to evaluate them from a mathematical standpoint.

item.title: Consensus Work
item.description: Consensus is the foundation of the network. It is how a group of peer-to-peer nodes understands how to agree on information in a distributed way.

item.title: Frequently Asked Questions
item.description: How much failure rate of erasure code transmission are we expecting. Basically, what are the EC coding parameters that we expect to be sending such that we have some failure rate of transmission?

item.title: Glacier: Consensus Candidate
item.description: Glacier is a consensus candidate for the Logos network that aims to be an improvement to the Avalanche family of consensus protocols.

item.title: Logos BFT Overview
item.description: Logos BFT is a consensus candidate for the Logos Network that utilizes Network Coding and Committees to optimize message propagation in the presence of a large number of nodes, while maintaining a high level of security.

item.title: Theoretical Analysis of the Snow Family of Consensus Protocols
item.description: In order to evaluate the properties of the Avalanche family of consensus protocols more rigorously than the original whitepapers, we work to create an analytical framework to explore and better understand the theoretical boundaries of the underlying protocols, and under what parameterization they will break vs a set of adversarial strategies
